website_summaries.verdict: These dot-generating washable paint markers are a good introduction to art for younger children not ready for traditional ink pens or paints.
pros: Uses a non-toxic paint base, not standard marker ink
Large sponge tip produces precise dots of color
Contains 6 basic but bold colors, ideal for young children
cons: Not completely washable, can stain skin and other surfaces

customer_reviews.title: Fun but not washable :(
customer_reviews.text: Washable?? My almost 3-year old son loved playing with these and I was excited to have a less messy paint option. Was surprised to discover the paint does not easily wash off skin with soap and water as advertised. Left his hands stained for a few days after washings and baths and I tried scrubbing his hands a bit immediately after use. I see some other reviewers have said the same and others have said it washes off easily...? How are people having such differing experiences with these? Is there some trick I'm not aware of or has the product changed? Would love to be able to use these more without having a stained toddler for days after...
customer_reviews.author: Shayna

customer_reviews.title: WARNING-NOT WASHABLE
customer_reviews.text: Although these markers are advertised as washable they are not washable. I've included two pictures with my review. The only way I could get the marker off of a plastic kids table is to use rubbing alcohol period soap and water would not take it off. When the kids got it on their clothes or their hands it was not easily removable with soap and water. It lasted a few days on their hands and lasted through baths. The concept for these markers is a great idea and the kids do have fun with them but if you're looking for something that is washable I would not suggest these.
customer_reviews.author: Beth W

customer_reviews.title: Go to gift for Toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Every child 18 months - 3+ years old should have and experience these! So easy and fun. Pinterest is a flurry with easy activities and free downlads for them. Buy them and gift them often!
customer_reviews.author: Mandy Forlenza Sticos

customer_reviews.title: As advertised!!!
customer_reviews.text: I used to use these in my classroom and always loved them because they are easy for little hands to grip and great for fine motor development! Besides, what kid does not love to pound?! And they are able to create art with a fun sound! Anyway, I bought these for my daughter and she is crazy about them. They are a fun alternative to paint for her. She has tactile issues with paint, so she loves her dot-a-dot art markers! They arrived in perfect shape and hold up well to my exuberant toddler!
customer_reviews.author: Halli Miller

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t even last 5 minutes!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible! I only gave my daughter 3 to start playing with. In no more than 5 minutes 2 were ripped and the third one was on its way. The daubing pad on 2 ripped making the ink spill out everywhere. What a huge mess and mistake.
customer_reviews.author: GoodHavens

customer_reviews.title: Classic dotters
customer_reviews.text: Expensive for what they are but of great quality. These dotters are the classic dotters that you don’t have to worry about losing their ink. Definitely worth the money since I haven’t found others on the market that are of better quality. Overall good product but wish the price was a tad better.
customer_reviews.author: lgj

customer_reviews.title: NOT WASHABLE!!!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves these. But they’re NOT WASHABLE!!!! He gets it all over his hands and it won’t wash off. Alcohol and nail polish remover don’t help either. False advertising!
customer_reviews.author: P. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: 2 and 4 year old approve
customer_reviews.text: Overall, we love this dot marker. We had an all day activity using it and at the end of the day, our window is full of dot marker artworks. I have a 2 and 4 year old and both of them can open and close the markers. No bleeding of colors too. The only thing I dislike is the "washable part". It is not 100% washable like their other "washable markers" that they have. It is hard to remove from a child's hand. Even mine. I needed to use a rough sponge.
customer_reviews.author: She

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for your toddler artist!
customer_reviews.text: My 18month old daughter absolutely loves these paint markers! I find that the mess is super easy to contain, as the markers do not drip and even if they fall they do not squirt paint everywhere. It's also super fun for toddlers who are beginning to experiment with paint and art materials in general. My daughter thinks it's the funnest thing to make paint dots on paper; she makes noises as she makes the dots and has now figured out that if she applies enough pressure, she can also make longer paint strokes. Great developmental tool to stimulate the artist in your toddler! :)
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Schiling

customer_reviews.title: Stains hands
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love these paint markers but they are just not what I thought they were. First, they may wash out of clothing but if the ink gets on my sons skin it is there for days even with careful washing. Second, 1 of the marker pads fell off on the first day of use. Now, after about 5 more uses another marker pad has fallen off. I am disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Clare

customer_reviews.title: Hard to wash off!!
customer_reviews.text: My kids LOVE this. 2 and 4 yr olds spent the rainy season with arts and crafts and this was always top choice for them. It doesnt spill out, the colors vibrant, dry fairly quickly and is easy to use. The only problem is that is it not as washable as advertised. Color didnt come off of clothes and i had to really work at the markings on the table and walls.
customer_reviews.author: kajyuyo

customer_reviews.title: Kids love these.....
customer_reviews.text: Seems that kids of all ages love these dot making items. Originally I was introduced to them when an occupational therapist introduced them to my autistic grandson & he loved them. Don't have to have a lot of skills to create a pic that is filled with love using big circles of color.
customer_reviews.author: B. Faw

customer_reviews.title: A fun art and craft item!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used these in my classroom for years so I decided to buy some for my grandkids. They’re great fun!! And very bright colors, too. I think they’re a great value because they are bigger than a “typical” child’s marker. Last night my granddaughter and I did caterpillars, gum ball machines. Oh yes - they’re washable! Win, win!
customer_reviews.author: Shopper Gal

customer_reviews.title: Develope toddler’s eye and hand function
customer_reviews.text: I saw my best friend’s son stamping them on some paper and he was able to follow it one after another. So i decided to get one for my daughter and within a week or so she was also able to follow and stamp at the correct spot! Best of all, these are so easy to washed off!
customer_reviews.author: BB0183

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for bored, quarantined children while we all recovered from coronavirus. Perfect for giving them an enjoyable distraction and an activity they could do with their very sick mother. Stood up well to the exuberant enthusiasm of a four year old. Easily cleaned off of hands and tabletop.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: No mess. Quick, easy fun.
customer_reviews.text: These are great. My 3yr old loves them. Easy to hold/control. Colors are great. She was a bit alarmed that they didnt work when I opened them but I showed her how to press and hold them down on the paper to release the paint. She got a kick out of that too :)
customer_reviews.author: SloaneLove

customer_reviews.title: Great for Toddlers
customer_reviews.text: These are very popular with young children, like 2-4 years old. My adult daughter takes them to church for the little ones to use while the adults worship. I got these for her to take, as well as some special dot coloring books. I've watched my youngest granddaughter "color" with these markers before, and I can tell it helps with her hand-eye coordination (using the books designed for these markers).
customer_reviews.author: Lori Calkins

customer_reviews.title: Used for homework and art fun
customer_reviews.text: My kindergartener wanted these to use at home for his school-assigned worksheets. He said they are the exact same that his speech therapy teacher uses. We used them for the intended purpose and for painting as well, which was unique and fun! So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and lots of fun!
customer_reviews.text: The Do A Dot markets were a hit with my granddaughter that just turned 2 years old. I was told they are more like paint than markers. She is enjoying them with the Do a Dot coloring books. The pictures are big and not detailed, geared for toddlers more.
customer_reviews.author: Cagney Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Painting without the mess
customer_reviews.text: This is a thousand times better than paints, cups of water to knock over, and paint brushes to clean. It isn't exactly the same effect, but close enough. Just have to be careful with little ones that they don't squeeze too hard (and have something under paper, like a plastic table cloth or play mat).
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for fine motor in children with special needs
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to use with my son who has autism. I began using them for art activities, but soon realized the benefit for their fine motor teaching skills. Because of his difficulties in writing and coloring, I sometimes use these instead of crayons or pencils. They have made school work more manageable when it comes to certain fine motor related work.
customer_reviews.author: Foxydell

customer_reviews.title: Rash from ink.
customer_reviews.text: Probably great for older kids and my 2 and 3 year olds LOVED THIS. But they squeeze out too much ink and get it on their arms and both my kids got a rash wherever the ink got on their skin. Wouldn't likely be a problem for an older child than my 2 and 3 year olds who are pretty messy. But that's why I took off stars. They LOVE IT though and ask to do this all the time. Now I only let them do it right before bath time.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: NOT washable and POOR choice for fine motor development
customer_reviews.text: NOT WASHABLE! Not washable off of skin, clothing, or furniture. Transfer from skin to clothing, towels, and furniture AFTER attempting to wash off with soap and water! Alcohol and nails polish do not help. Stains on hands last for days and stains on clothing and furniture are permanent. Honestly I don’t understand why anyone gives these to little kids. As a pediatric occupational therapist I can say these are NOT good for developing hand skills, arches of the hands, or intrinsic hand muscles.
customer_reviews.author: VT

customer_reviews.title: Fun to work with
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old and 6 year old love these. They can be a little messy especially since they take a bit to dry. They aren't as bad as if we had used tubs of paint. They are cute colors and there are soo many learning dot papers you can print or buy to go with these. Id say these are great for homeschooling.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha

customer_reviews.title: Mess free, easy fun
customer_reviews.text: My 3 yr old daughter is obsessed with these and frankly, so am I. It's great with dot pictures and for easy dot sticker activities. Nice little cardboard box carrying case. Washes off skin and table.
customer_reviews.author: SunshineGirl

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stuff that does not come off of tiny fingers
customer_reviews.text: These dot markers are bright, colorful and generously easy to use. My toddler class loves them! Although the colors do wash out of clothes and off non-permeable surfaces, I embarrassingly send home my children with neon fingers. Our center’s cleaners also do not get the color off of our tables or our vinyl floor. It takes about a week of regular washing for it to wear off... Kind of like a henna tattoo.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon York

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I've tried lots of dotters, but Do-A-Dot are my favorite. We use them at the library a lot for children's programs. They're easy to clean, they don't dry out, and they produce nice, consistent circles. They may be a little more expensive that some other brands, but I think it's work it in the long run because they're reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Superamy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect craft option for toddlers!
customer_reviews.text: Our toddler loves these and he’s created countless art projects for grandparents, relatives, Father’s Day/Mother’s Day, etc.! He uses them with a monster truck coloring book and they haven’t bled through the pages, and we also use them on thick construction paper - we even use them on canvas and they work great! It’s been the perfect option for our little one and has helped with his fine motor skills!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonUser521

customer_reviews.title: Art Supply for Toddler
customer_reviews.text: If you love art, this is a great product for a toddler or a parent or teacher of a toddler. They are durable, exceptionally well made. The markers really wash up easily and last for a long time. I recommend this highly.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Holbrook

customer_reviews.title: Even better than I remember them!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my niece and they are exactly as I remember them. Amazing! Such a fun, low mess way to paint! We made art projects on her roll of paper, poster board, the back of paper plates, these are great for everything! One of the best craft purchases this auntie has made!
customer_reviews.author: Joanna

customer_reviews.title: Fun product, would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product, my 3 year old son isn’t a big fan of art projects but loves using these, he’s finally branching out and making art other then just drawing worms or mud, his older sisters also enjoy these, I wish I bought them sooner but debated a long time because they seemed pricey
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Nice markers for little hands
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my 2 year old granddaughter, and she loves them! I had to squeeze and press them to get the paint started, but then they worked well for her. They fit her hand nicely for lots of fine motor development. I was pleased with these markers and recommend them for little ones.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Hollobaugh

customer_reviews.title: Good dotters
customer_reviews.text: My kids love these! Wipes off pretty well from most surfaces. Bright colors but sometimes they make a donut instead of a dot.
customer_reviews.author: JM13

customer_reviews.title: Pretty but break easily
customer_reviews.text: These markers are great colors but the tops (the sponge? Marker part) ripped pretty quickly. My son was quite hard on them, but I was bummed.
customer_reviews.author: M. Koi

customer_reviews.title: Works well if monitored by adult
customer_reviews.text: Great for pre-K as long as they don't drag the bottle (the sponge will rip) and as long as they don't mix the colors because it will ruin the pad
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Washable!!!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 and 3 year old grandsons love using these. It's good for coordination and the dot books are fun. Best of all as they mark up each other, it is soap and water washable.
customer_reviews.author: Supsy500

customer_reviews.title: but great color variety
customer_reviews.text: Over priced for the quality, but great color variety. It also washes off skin very easily with just a baby wipe. Seems to leave a full dot when pressed, only every couple times. Very inconsistent compared to other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Bolitho Family

customer_reviews.title: Damaged packaging- harder to store and stay organized.
customer_reviews.text: Kids loved this and the older 2 started reminiscing about their Pre K years 🤣 Unfortunately the packaging was all beat up so we couldn’t put them back in the box. They were entertained for a good hour just painting away.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Felt a part quick
customer_reviews.text: My kids loved this markers! My two years old could use them with ease. Only problem is they used them 3-4 times and the fabric on the marker tip rubbed right off so they can’t use them anymore. Love the product maybe just buy a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: maria

customer_reviews.title: Had some problems at first getting ink to flow but once it got going she liked a lot
customer_reviews.text: Gift for my three year old granddaughter. Had some problems at first getting ink to flow but once it got going she liked a lot ... I like that tops are screw on not push on like markers. That way they are sealed tight and don't dry out as fast
customer_reviews.author: billmcdonald

customer_reviews.title: Great for toddlers! High quality
customer_reviews.text: My toddler loves these. He is into banging his crayons and markers so these are perfect for him to go up and down and smash them because they won't break. Tons of fun. Kind of pricey but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Forbes

customer_reviews.title: missing color
customer_reviews.text: i ordered two boxes of different do a dot art and the rainbow box came with only 5 colors instead of 6 missing the green dot one. is there a way i could get the green color do a dot sent to us without having to send the whole thing back.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: We love these markers!
customer_reviews.text: Great vibrant colors and very easy for little hands to use! We have found lots of fun activities for these, and I love that they don't dry out if someone happens to leave the tops off. The ink has been difficult to wash out of some materials, unfortunately. I also think they are a little expensive, but they seem like they will last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: ATLMamaTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart after first use
customer_reviews.text: My daughters were so excited to get these dot markers. The second time we brought them out to draw the sponge on the tip shredded apart on four of the markers. It is so thin and flimsy and there is no way to replace the tops. We now have a set of completely full markers that are unusable. I would not recommend buying these until they make them with a different material for the tip.
customer_reviews.author: pulfer4457

customer_reviews.title: Big hit!
customer_reviews.text: My kids LOVE these. My 4 year old says she uses them at preschool and my 2.5 year old is obsessed with them too! He will ask for it several times a day and sit for long periods of time. It takes a bit of practice as they need to be pressed gently or the color will splash everywhere. But definitely a big hit in our home.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Great for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Bought this along with the Dot pens for my 3 year old grandson's birthday. It works great for hand eye coordination and he enjoyed coloring the pictures. His mom loved it too as not too messy.
customer_reviews.author: Jill C.

customer_reviews.title: Came defective!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought Do a Dots before and never had a problem. Very disappointed that this seller sold damaged products! I have no way of contacting them but these are too messy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Bear

customer_reviews.title: Not true purple
customer_reviews.text: When something is marketed as rainbow colored like this product. I expect 3 primary colors and 3 true secondary colors. The "purple" here is much to pink despite the description and packaging suggesting otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Girl

customer_reviews.title: Bad product
customer_reviews.text: One of the worst products I have purchased. A pricey product. The little sponge tears easily after few time of use, had a replacement and same thing happened. Doesn't wash easily and stays on skin for days. Do not recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: dana

customer_reviews.title: Great way to teach math to kids
customer_reviews.text: My son use these in their dot journals that we got from Lakeshore and we also use them for their math homework since they’re in kindergarten and learning addition and subtraction. They’re so much fun to use for kids and they learn through having fun.
customer_reviews.author: LoveBooks

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: These came in handy big time with this stay at home thing. My son used these at preschool so it was nice to be able to buy them online. They are very pigmented and easy to hold for my 4 year old
customer_reviews.author: YOPORO

customer_reviews.title: Sponge ripped
customer_reviews.text: Product images show it being used to “paint” with. I tried it on this pumpkin and sponge ripped to being unusable, so I finished with a brush. I would say ok to use if you ONLY paint dots, not like a marker.
customer_reviews.author: OUKristy

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but fun
customer_reviews.text: I hesitated to get this bc it is pricey, but if you break it down it is $2 per marker, which is a bit easier to swallow. My kids have so much fun with these. They dot away for minutes at a time. I have to take them outside to do it bc it tends to get messy.
customer_reviews.author: J. AN

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!!!
customer_reviews.text: These daubers are the best!! I use them in my classroom constantly. They last a long time, however, I usually buy two new boxes to start off every school year and those boxes usually make it through the whole year. They are easily held by preschoolers and don't leak. Even my 20 month old great grandson loves to "dot!" using these. A quality product that I will definitely be ordering again.
customer_reviews.author: robin

customer_reviews.title: I like these but they aren't super washable off the skin
customer_reviews.text: I like these but they aren't super washable off the skin. My daughters hands remain pretty splotchy for a while after.
customer_reviews.author: Kate N

customer_reviews.title: Great for creative little hands
customer_reviews.text: Since we received this, my 2 year old granddaughter has played with it non-stop. The Dot markers make it easy to use, and the size is perfect for little hands. We won't know how long the colors last, but each one seems like it has enough paint to last a while. Much easier to use than paint, and less messy.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie D

customer_reviews.title: Not washable, stain skin, don’t recommend.
customer_reviews.text: These markers are NOT washable! They stained my children for days. Trying to get this off of their skin is impossible. We had to wait for it to wear off days later. I wish these were really washable because they would be great. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle M Hickey

customer_reviews.title: My niece loved these markers
customer_reviews.text: The markers are easy for my 4 year old niece to hold and the colors are nice and bright. It is easy for a small child to color with these markers. Am not sure how easy these are to clean
customer_reviews.author: CJ Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great concept
customer_reviews.text: My 17 month old grandson loves them. A lot easier to use than markers and a nice change from his Aqua Doodle. Keeps him engaged and away from television.
customer_reviews.author: susan dancause

customer_reviews.title: 2 year old son and 4 year old daughter loves these
customer_reviews.text: 2 year old son and 4 year old daughter love "dotting" with these! washable with water or any other cleaner. have not had a problem with staining
customer_reviews.author: kellyRN

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson who is almost 2, and I use these everyday! He says “dots” and we go play dots! They are easy to use, and great for learning colors! I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: carol carmack

customer_reviews.title: Dots looked faint
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed because I expected a deeper color. These made faint dots, but it's possible we needed to just keep using it and the dots would become darker.
customer_reviews.author: AnnaC

customer_reviews.title: Colorful and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: My 2 1/2 granddaughter loves to color with them. You have got to try hard to make them messey and the pictures turn out very colorful. The next test is my 3 year old twin grandsons.
customer_reviews.author: Jebr

customer_reviews.title: Quiet Table time Activity
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my grandkids. They love these markers. I print out dot art pages from the computer and the children use these markers to color in the dots. Gross motor skills.
customer_reviews.author: Mary B

customer_reviews.title: Do-A-Dot Art Markers
customer_reviews.text: My 18 mo old granddaughter gets markers everywhere so this one is perfect for her because it washes out. And the pens are easy to hold
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and fun
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my grandkids ages 3-9 and they loved it. They were able to use them to be very creative. Clean up was so easy too!
customer_reviews.author: Gladys E. Thorp

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, affordable lunch box for toddler
customer_reviews.text: I'm pleased with this and all of the other owl-themed Skip Hop products I've purchased. My toddler loves this and it's the perfect size for him. It also seems easy to clean and like it will hold up pretty well. When I bought this, I think it was only about $9, which I consider a steal.
customer_reviews.author: booklover82

customer_reviews.title: FUN At PLAY
customer_reviews.text: I got these markers for my granddaughter. She loves to color so I thought we would try something different. She loves them and it provides a quiet time for me to sit with her. This is a very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Good markers
customer_reviews.text: Dot markers are a must for a busy mom. These have not dried out and they are fat for little toddler hands to hold. They make quick work of any art work I have the kids match with the dot stickers.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Percecc
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome do-a-dot art markers. They are perfect for little hands! All the colors are perfect and bright. Exactly what we needed! Very happy!!
customer_reviews.author: Love to Shop!

customer_reviews.title: perfect gift
customer_reviews.text: Love these, they were the perfect gift little holiday gift for my nephews that are 2 and 3.5 years old. Such a fun and easy way to get little ones to start exploring art. Helps develop motor skills, colors and more, plus easy clean up is a great bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy C

customer_reviews.title: Favorite for kid painting
customer_reviews.text: My kids love these, and at 35, I like playing with them too... with my kids of course ;) They are so easy for little hands, bright colors, easily washable. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Pia J.

customer_reviews.title: Fun but flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Kids love these. The foam on the top came off the first day of use. I hope to find a dot marker that is more resilient.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect for my toddler, however make sure you watch them while using as the top foam can be damaged if it is slides on the paper. It's only meant to dot on the paper.
customer_reviews.author: DCM1516

customer_reviews.title: Every kid needs these!
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing!! My kids love to paint and on days that I don't want to deal with all the mess of brushes and water, we use these. They're great for my 1 year old to use, but my 5 year old loves them as well, and has made some adorable paintings with them. She can easily unscrew the caps and then put them back on when she's done. We use these all the time!
customer_reviews.author: mc2cmt

customer_reviews.title: Toddlers love it!
customer_reviews.text: Fun. Create. Learn with these stampers. We enjoy doing colors with this while staying home, my 3 yr old loves it.
customer_reviews.author: ~Love2BMom

customer_reviews.title: Foam falls off very easily
customer_reviews.text: My son (3 yo) loved these! Only problem is that foam on top is fallen off after first single use! Very dissatisfied...
customer_reviews.author: Javier Saenz

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, especially for smaller hands. Clean up is simple and these make great gifts. Kids will love them.
customer_reviews.author: MissyfromOK

customer_reviews.title: Colors are good!
customer_reviews.text: I loved these growing up. Bought for my 18 month old during quarantine and he loves it. He has been matching the caps to the bases--even more educational.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Smith

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: It was what I was looking for. Non toxic, not messy, and adds artistry to anything my daughter colors. It never dries so that a super plus! Colors are bright. Would highly recommend for ages 3+.
customer_reviews.author: DXM

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use
customer_reviews.text: My grandsons ages 4 and 5 both love using these dot markers. The colors are bright and let them gave a different look to their art work.
customer_reviews.author: lovestoquilt

customer_reviews.title: Padding tears
customer_reviews.text: I love this type of product for toddlers to “paint” with, so I have used a number of brands over the years. Was disappointed that the spongy padding on the tip tore on several markers, within a week of first use (by one kid).
customer_reviews.author: mirandamac80

customer_reviews.title: Kiddos love them...Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: My kids adored these and there are lots of free school printables online that we use them with. Three of the six tops tore almost immediately so I called Do-A-Dot. Customer service was a human being from AMERICA! that quickly replaced our torn tops. Hopefully the new tops will hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond B.

customer_reviews.title: So fun, minus a leak.
customer_reviews.text: We just received them today, and my son was so excited to use them! We opened the package and unfortunately the green dotter leaked all over and even more came out when I took the lid off, but at least it was easy to clean off the other markers. The other colors are great though!
customer_reviews.author: andrea

customer_reviews.title: Fun and messy!
customer_reviews.text: Kids love these. Just make sure you supervise, they are kind of messy because a lot of ink can come out!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan A.

customer_reviews.title: Adds variety
customer_reviews.text: Great way to add variety to our arts and crafts time. Nice switch up from paint, markers, crayons, watercolors, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: These are Great for doing art pictures. My 3 yr old & 5 yr old love painting, but with these there is no mess. Now we do art more often which is their favorite. Google art ideas for these and you will see how easy it is to do art with toddlers. Making a rainbow was my daughters favorite. :D
customer_reviews.author: samspoofyorganics

customer_reviews.title: Fun Learning
customer_reviews.text: I bought these so I could present a lesson plan about grouping to my classmates. As a future teacher I definitely will buy more and keep around my classroom as a special reward. I highly recommend especially for teachers. My college friends loved it so you know kids will too.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Shuart

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase! Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Great size for chubby toddler hands. Color comes out very bright and vivid. My son loves it and is always asking to “paint” - will definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: DTMartin

customer_reviews.title: Kids love the Dotters
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for little hands, they do smear a bit because to much of the ink comes out but they dry fairly quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Dot away
customer_reviews.text: My 2 yr old loves these. He dots everything and it washes off easily on surfaces but is a bit harder to get off fingers
customer_reviews.author: Teabella415

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a toddler or young child during arts and crafts time. Something different from regular crayons and markers.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Mulligan

customer_reviews.title: Dependable
customer_reviews.text: I buy these all the time for my preschool. They last forever and are super easy for the kids to use.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Wilder

customer_reviews.title: Fun for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use once you shake them! Children loved using them. One of the colors was not a true and accurate color.
customer_reviews.author: Ro

customer_reviews.title: Great for toddlers to use!
customer_reviews.text: These are great for my 3 year old and 2 year old to play with! I just draw something on some paper and let them use their imagination to do the rest! Little mess to clean up and they wash off easy if they get them on their hands or anything like that.
customer_reviews.author: saj

customer_reviews.title: Great for class
customer_reviews.text: I like to use this for my kindergartners , perfect size for little hands and they enjoy using them.
customer_reviews.author: Misty Mckibbin

customer_reviews.title: The little girl loves them!
customer_reviews.text: It was a requested gift. The little girl was so excited to have a new package of dot markers!
customer_reviews.author: Colleen M. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Really great activity for toddlers! Can gwt a little wet paint on fingers but not too bad and washes off easily.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: My granddaughter loves these!
customer_reviews.text: My three year old granddaughter loves to color with these. In fact, she had to take them home with her....good that I got two boxes so there will be a box for her next visit!
customer_reviews.author: Diearle

customer_reviews.title: High quality!
customer_reviews.text: I have this a few months already and it's still in perfect condition! Really a great value!
customer_reviews.author: A. C.

product_meta.title: Do A Dot Art! Markers 6-Pack Rainbow Washable Paint Markers, The Original Dot Marker
feature_bullets: 🇺🇸MADE IN THE USA. Designed and manufactured in our own factory guaranteeing that you are getting the best product without the risk of unknown and unwanted contaminants, using only the highest quality materials and standards to ensure kids have endless fun, and parents and teachers have piece of mind. All Do A Dot Art! markers are GLUTEN FREE and LATEX FREE.
👍EASY TO GRIP BOTTLE FOR LITTLE HANDS: With generous 2.5 ounce bottles. Do A Dot Art makers have more paint per bottle than other dot markers. Just twist off the cap and let the creativity begin

🧒FUN ART MEDIUM FOR CHILDREN OF ALL AGES: Do A Dot Art markers have a PATENTED large sponge tip dauber engineered to be mess free, never dry out, and make a perfect dot every time. Kids love mixing, blending and layering colors to create masterpieces

🎨NO CUPS, NO BRUSH, NO MESS: Washable dot markers are easy set up clean up. Comes with 5 non-toxic colors in no spill, no splash bottles. Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, Violet. GLUTEN FREE and LATEX FREE

🚌PROMOTES EARLY CHILDHOOD DEVELOPMENT: Designed for layered learning, which gives children the opportunity to do original planning and thinking while creating expressive art, developing hand eye coordination and color recognition. DRIES QUICKLY
